page.title: 06OLD PEOPLES HOME
page.content: Rushall Mews/Shelfield Clinic. The Rushall Mews old peoples home, opened on the 26th October 1984, by the Duke of Gloucester. Of the four suites the Kensington and Linley provide long stay accommodation, the Avon and Chelsea are for short stays. There are also bed-sits which are small self-contained homes where the residents can cook, eat and sleep independently. In all rooms the Piper Alarm System is connected to Matron's office. Reception contains clothes, toiletries and hairdressing shops. Shelfield Community Clinic acts as post-operative centre. It has four District Nurses, four health visitors, one school nurse, two midwives and one dentist with a nurse.
